sj224.tflp.util

Class BloomFilter<V>

  • java.lang.Object
    • sj224.tflp.util.BloomFilter<V>
  • Type Parameters:
    V - The type of value being "stored."
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.function.Predicate<V>

    public class BloomFilter<V>
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.util.function.Predicate<V>
    A counting Bloom Filter; a type of probabilistic dictionary backed by an array of integers (The non-counting version would be backed by an array of booleans, and lack support for the removal operation.) Assuming no removal operations are made, the probability of a false negative is 0, but the probability of a false positive will increase as you add more items.
    Author:
    SuperJedi224

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BloomFilter()
      Constructs a counting bloom filter with 64 cells in the backing array
      BloomFilter(int space)
      Constructs a counting bloom filter, allowing the user to specify the size of the backing array
      BloomFilter(java.lang.Iterable<V> source)
      Constructs a counting bloom filter with 64 cells in the backing array, then fills it with values from the specified iterable

    • Method Detail

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Empties the bloom filter

      • contains

        public boolean contains(V v)
        Checks if the bloom filter may contain the specified element. While probability of a false negative is 0 (assuming no removals have been made) the probability of a false positive is not.
        Parameters:
        v - The value being checked for.
        Returns:
        true if it determines that the value is present, false otherwise

      • remove

        public boolean remove(V v)
        Checks if a value is present, according to the conventions of the contains operator, removing it if present.
        Parameters:
        v - The value being removed
        Returns:
        true if the backing array was modified as a result, false otherwise

        The number of elements currently in the Bloom Filter.
